summary:
Greek is an ancient Indo-European language with a long history, spoken in Greece, Cyprus, and nearby regions. It has been written for over 3,400 years, first using the Linear B script. The Greek alphabet, created from the Phoenician script, has influenced many other writing systems.

Greek is important in Western history, with famous works like Homer's epics. Many scientific and philosophical texts were written in Greek, and it was the language of the New Testament. Today, it is the official language of Greece and Cyprus and is spoken by millions worldwide.
title: Greek language
